'''Steven Harris''' is a British cartoonist and writer, based in London. His first novel, 'Eustace', was published in March 2013.
==Career== Harris contributed the illustrations for a range of books in the Nightingale Press's ''Modern Anthropology'' range of humorous ''Modern Guides'', including ''Hats'' (which he also authored),<ref>{{Citation | last=Harris | first=Steve | year=2000 | title=A Modern Guide to Hats | url=http://catalogue.bl.uk/F/91XRX4P3TVHD445IPYKAHTXIR6743XL4QRVE1AP3J8HI6SPF6D-28129?func=full-set-set&set_number=085330&set_entry=000036&format=999}}</ref> ''Drink'',<ref>{{Citation | last=Sargeant M | first=Paul | year=2000 | title=A Modern Guide to Drink | url=http://catalogue.bl.uk/F/91XRX4P3TVHD445IPYKAHTXIR6743XL4QRVE1AP3J8HI6SPF6D-35248?func=full-set-set&set_number=085330&set_entry=000035&format=999}}</ref> and ''Spectacles''.<ref>{{Citation | last=Sargeant | first=Paul | year=2000 | title=A Modern Guide to Spectacles | url=http://catalogue.bl.uk/F/91XRX4P3TVHD445IPYKAHTXIR6743XL4QRVE1AP3J8HI6SPF6D-29585?func=full-set-set&set_number=085330&set_entry=000037&format=999}}</ref>
Harris also authored the long-running web comics ''Paper Cuts'' and ''Eustace'', both published on [[H2G2]] under the pseudonym spimcoot.<ref>{{Citation | last=Spimcoot | year=2001–2003 | title=Paper Cuts | url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/dna/h2g2/A643583}} {{Citation | last=Spimcoot | year=2003 | title=Eustace | url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/dna/h2g2/A942077}}</ref> During time spent with an artists' collective in [[Angoulême]], France, he also contributed satirical French cartoons to a daily [[Charente]] newspaper, again under the name spimcoot.
His novel length version of the Eustace comics, 'Eustace', was published in hardback by Jonathan Cape in March 2013. It concerns the adventures of a bed-bound boy, joined by a "swelling cast of hoodlums, models, drunkards and politicians".<ref>{{Citation | last=Harris | first=Steven | year=2013 | title=Eustace | url=https://www.amazon.co.uk/Eustace-S-J-Harris/dp/0224093584/ref=sr_1_fkmr2_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1349365242&sr=8-1-fkmr2 }}</ref> He is currently writing the second book in the Eustace quartet.<ref>{{Citation | title=Q&A:SJ Harris | date=2 February 2013 | url=http://capegraphicnovels.tumblr.com/post/43737013166/q-a-s-j-harris}}</ref>
